activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:07 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cassandra Yvonne Bernay in court.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl in court for Cassandra Yvonne Bernay. Court Reporter Donna Moore.  State files an amended information.  Plea to Ct. 1 in the amended info.  The court is handed a signed plea questionnaire and drug court acceptance.Upon plea to Ct. 1 the State would recommend, 12 mo DLR, $350 fine, 6 points, No IID.  Plea to Ct. 2, the State would recommend i/s prison, 24 months probation and appropriate conditions.  Court performs plea colloquy with the defendant.  CC used as a factual basis.  Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters her plea.  Parties make sentencing arguments.  State is recommending drug treatment court.  
Plea:
21CF1743:
Ct. 1- GUILTY
Ct. 2- GUILTY
BTC:
Ct. 1- GUILTY, $350 Fine, court costs, 12 Mo. DLR, 6 points, AODA. Payment plan of $100/month beginning on May 15, 2022. 
Ct. 2- GUILTY, 3 1/2 years WPS, 18 mo. IC and 18 mo. ES. i/s, 24 months probation.  
All remaining counts DRI.
22CF1: DRI.

Conditions:
120 Days RCJ. STAYED. 
Comply with drug court rules.
Do not drive unless properly licensed. 
No alcohol or controlled substances to be monitored by random UA's/breathalyzers.  AODA assessment and any follow through with any recommendations from agent.  
Comply with any juvenile court orders.
Court Costs.
DNA Sample and Surcharge. 
FAW/Vote.
Eligible for CIP and SAP if revoked.

ADDRESS INFO for Cassandra Yvonne Bernay
Current: 2425 Illinois St, Racine, WI 53405 United States  (Effective: 01-13-2022)
Prior: 3435 Daisy Lane, Racine, WI 53405
by DA to Defense to Obtain Copies of Certain Evidence.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No contact with the co-defendant; and minor children.  Do not drive at all. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 01-13-2022: May have contact with minor children pursuant to CHIPS case ordered.
NG plea entered.
